sentence.Network_en: But fateful forces beyond the band's control were to conspire against them.
sentence.Network_cn: 然而，乐队无力控制的各种决定性力量将会对他们造成不利的影响。

sentence.Network_en: It was just one of those times when you wonder whether the fates conspire against you.
sentence.Network_cn: 有些时候，你会怀疑是不是造化弄人，现在就是如此。

sentence.Network_en: Yet, in real life, circumstances do sometimes conspire to bring about coincidences which anyone but a nineteenth century novelist would find incredible.
sentence.Network_cn: 然而在实际生活中, 有些事情有时候的确好象神差鬼使一样地促成了一些除了十九世纪小说家外谁也不会相信的巧合.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Old French conspirer, from Latin conspirare 'agree, plot', from con- 'together with' + spirare 'breathe'

entry.def: If two or more people or groups conspire to do something illegal or harmful, they make a secret agreement to do it.

example.ex: They'd conspired to overthrow the government...
example.tran: 他们曾经密谋推翻政府。

example.ex: Mr Farmer and Mrs Jones both admitted conspiring to murder her husband.
example.tran: 法默先生和琼斯太太都承认密谋杀死了琼斯先生。

entry.tran: (事件)凑在一起致使，共同导致
entry.def: If events conspire to produce a particular result, they seem to work together to cause this result.

example.ex: History and geography have conspired to bring Greece to a moment of decision...
example.tran: 历史和地理因素共同将希腊推至作出抉择的紧要关头。

example.ex: But fateful forces beyond the band's control were to conspire against them.
example.tran: 然而，乐队无力控制的各种决定性力量将会对他们造成不利的影响。

means.word_mean: 1. engage in plotting or enter into a conspiracy, swear together;
2. act in unison or agreement and in secret towards a deceitful or illegal purpose;

sentences.sentence: "The two companies conspired to cause the value of the stock to fall"

auth_sentence.content: So, conspire to get rid of all mosquitoes?
auth_sentence.res_content: So, conspire to get rid of all mosquitoes?
auth_sentence.res_content_con: So, conspire to get rid of all mosquitoes?

auth_sentence.content: Haiti itself seems to conspire against its people.
auth_sentence.res_content: Haiti itself seems to conspire against its people.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Haiti itself seems to conspire against its people.

auth_sentence.content: Or will it continue to conspire against a democratic neighbor?
auth_sentence.res_content: Or will it continue to conspire against a democratic neighbor?
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Or will it continue to conspire against a democratic neighbor?

stems_affixes.value_cn: 热心的,积极的,有抱负的
stems_affixes.word_buile: aspire[v.[to,after]渴望,追求,有志于]+ing表形容词→adj.热心的,积极的,有抱负的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 精神饱满的;生机勃勃的
stems_affixes.word_buile: spirit精神+ed……的→adj.精神饱满的;生机勃勃的
spirit精神+ual……的→adj.精神[上]的,心灵的
conspire[v.阴谋,同谋,谋叛]+acy表名词→n.阴谋,密谋,共谋
expire[v.期满,[期限]终止;呼气;断气,死亡]+ation表名词→n.期满,终止
inspire[v.鼓舞,激起;使产生灵感]+ation表名词→n.灵感;鼓舞,激励
spir呼吸,精神+it名词→n.精神;志气;[n.]情绪,心情;[n.]酒精
a加强+spir呼吸,精神+e→看到希望的东西加强呼吸→渴望,追求
dis去掉+pirit=spirit精神→去掉精神→使沮丧

stems_affixes.value_cn: 期满,[期限]终止;呼气;断气,死亡
stems_affixes.word_buile: ex出+pire=spir呼吸→有出气没进气→断气
in进入+spir呼吸,精神+e→吸气进去→引申为鼓励
per全部+spir呼吸+e→全身呼吸→出汗
trans改变,交流+spir呼吸,精神+e→互相呼吸→transpire泄漏

sentences.en: The criminals conspired to rob a bank.
Events conspired to produce great difficulties for us.
sentences.cn: 各种事件凑在一起给我们带来了很大困难。

jushi.english: The criminals conspired to rob a bank.
Events conspired to produce great difficulties for us.
jushi.chinese: 各种事件凑在一起给我们带来了很大困难。
